name: Broiled Salmon with Soy-Ginger Glaze
author: Yvonne
summary: This is the absolute tastiest broiled salmon I've ever had, and only takes about 25 minutes from start to finish! Using just a few ingredients, you will have delicious meal in no time. I recommend serving it with steamed edamame or broccoli and brown rice.
directions: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler
Line a heat-resistant baking dish (such as Pyrex®) with aluminum foil and place salmon, skin-side down, in the dish
Mix soy sauce, ginger, honey, sesame seeds, and cayenne pepper together in a small bowl until honey is dissolved
Pour over salmon fillet, making sure top of salmon is completely covered
Cook under the preheated broiler until top of salmon has begun to turn golden brown, 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from the oven and baste the top of the fillet with glaze
Turn the broiler off and preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C)
Return to the preheated oven and bake until fish has a rich, dark brown glaze and flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes
